I thought `output: false` would suppress the output, but no? `echo: false` does it.

```{observable}
//| echo: false

import {text} from '@jashkenas/inputs'

viewof name = text({
  title: "what's your name?",
  value: ''
})
```

## `label`

```{observable}
//| label: python-label-1
name
```

**(Python Bug?) This appears to break with long labels:**

```{observable}
//| label: python label 1
name
```

### `fig.cap`

```{observable}
//| fig.cap: A caption for the figure
name
```

**(Styling Bug?) Centering of images appears inconsistent depending on whether they have captions?**

### `fig.subcap`

```{observable}
//| fig.cap: Big caption
//| fig.subcap: 
//|   - Caption 1
//|   - Caption 2
name + " 1"
name + " 2"
```

**(Python Bug?) Sub-captions don't show up unless `fig.cap` is also there:**

```{observable}
//| fig.subcap: 
//|   - Caption 1
//|   - Caption 2
name + " 1"
name + " 2"
```

### `fold`

**Inconsistency? The R engine uses fold="true" for both the outer and inner div; The Python engine only forwards it to the inner div.**
```{observable}
//| fold: true
name
```
